channel.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
channel.description:
If i change the servers IP to my No-IP it wont let you log into the client... not sure why? But if i change it back to 127.0.0.1 it works perfectly fine.... [I]Help![/I]
Images v
[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/072kv5fqb6rd1bd/Untitled.png?dl=0]https://www.dropbox.com/s/072kv5fqb6rd1bd/Untitled.png?dl=0[/url]
[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/76wmoe9355gizy9/Untitled3.png?dl=0]https://www.dropbox.com/s/76wmoe9355gizy9/Untitled3.png?dl=0[/url]
[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/p8ieh4chu2j5lqo/rbnotwork.png?dl=0]https://www.dropbox.com/s/p8ieh4chu2j5lqo/rbnotwork.png?dl=0[/url]
[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/eysdmam1lf0oopz/rbhelp.png?dl=0]https://www.dropbox.com/s/eysdmam1lf0oopz/rbhelp.png?dl=0[/url]

item.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
item.dc:creator: @Reckless_f8 Reckless f8
item.description:
@Reckless_f8 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:9, topic:551814”]everything on that screen is tivial
protocol: tcp
port: 43594

the name and stuff seems pretty useless so just enter whatever
as for host, idk what you have to do there

see if the post I posted earlier with the link doesn’t do anything similar[/quote]

*Fixed i just went to go look at my um static or dynamic port thing… bleh… and it was dynamic made it static and its open again i feelz dumb but thank you

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
item.dc:creator: @Reckless_f8 Reckless f8
item.description:
@Reckless_f8 wrote:

Cres:

try looking in port managment, seems pretty straightforward

obviously :palm: lol i been spending alot of time in that section but the only thing there is : port forwarding / port triggering / dmz host / upnp,
now if i try to port forward 43594 it looks like this: https://www.dropbox.com/s/cihr1fxzprr6abf/Portpic.png?dl=0
https://www.dropbox.com/s/cihr1fxzprr6abf/Portpic.png?dl=0

item.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
item.dc:creator: @Reckless_f8 Reckless f8
item.description:
@Reckless_f8 wrote:

[quote author=Cres link=topic=670731.msg4485219#msg4485219 date=1433600952]
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html

about halfway through the page there is a section on how to portforward through the system console
[/quote

so like about right here (you will need to click something like ‘Applications and gaming’, though mine just says 'Firewall) i dont have the options firewall / applicantions and gaming my options for my router are: File and media sharing/WPS/Advanced settigns - (under advanced settings): Advanced wireless/LAN,WAN setup/ Port Management/ DNS Managment

(thanks for your replies btw)

Read full topic

item.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
item.dc:creator: @Reckless_f8 Reckless f8
item.description:
@Reckless_f8 wrote:

Cres:

you may have to portforward

i use to be portforwarded, and port 43594 was open for me but i checked yesterday and its not… i went to my router login to go re-open port 43594 and i just got confused idk how i portforwarded the first time, ive been looking at tutorials but they seem drasticaly different from what i got… is there any chance you can help me out with this? via skype, team veiwer or i can just put up screenshots…

Read full topic
item.source: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!

item.title: Cant connect to server when IP is changed to No-Ip but works with 127 SOLVED!
item.dc:creator: @uncalled_for uncalled for
item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

You (the host), cannot login to the client with your no-ip. You have to login with 127.0.0.1, however your players will need to login with the no-ip client.

Read full topic
